content: Newspaper in Singapore ***Berita Harian*** ([Malay](/wiki/Malay_language) for "Daily News") is the sole [Malay-language](/wiki/Malay_language) broadsheet newspaper published in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It is published daily from Monday to Saturday, and on Sunday as ***Berita Minggu*** ([Malay](/wiki/Malay_language): "Sunday News"). This newspaper is indirectly connected to the Malaysian paper of the same name, *[Berita Harian](/wiki/Berita_Harian)*. Both papers originated from a single publication founded on 1 July 1957. They were separated in September 1972, after which the Singaporean edition became *[de jure](/wiki/De_jure)* non-politically aligned and concentrated on Singapore-related news, while the Malaysian edition continued to maintain an alignment with the [United Malays National Organisation](/wiki/United_Malays_National_Organisation) (UMNO). - [Suria](/wiki/Suria_(TV_channel)) - [Ria 897](/wiki/Ria_897) - [Warna 942](/wiki/Warna_942) - (in Malay) Berita Harian Singapore - cyBerita (Berita Harian archives) at the [Wayback Machine](/wiki/Wayback_Machine) (archive index) (in Malay) This article related to newspapers in Singapore is a stub.
